creator: tenthumbs@cybernex.net
text:
While building apache 2.0.42 the configure script said variable length 
arrays weren't supported. On x86 Linux that's clearly incorrect. Gcc has 
been able to do this for a long time.

What happened is that I passed CFLAGS="-g -Wall -W -O" to ./configure. You 
use your APR_TRY_COMPILE_NO_WARNING macro but you test code is not warning 
free so it fails.

I think you should have a special test for gcc or eliminate the potential
warnings.

creator: joe@manyfish.co.uk
text:
Yes, the VLA test also fails if --enable-maintainer-mode is used because of
these warnings.
This is now fixed in CVS HEAD - thanks for the report.
